root: ^“No need to answer, I can already tell you are having a wonderful morning!”
^Boy do you wish that were true.
^“Did you figure out what to do about the lake yet?”
^She seems shifty, as if she wants to say something but isn’t sure.
^“Say, how do you feel about this job? Is your Boss nice??”
^You are very conscious about your answer here, just in case your Boss is somehow miraculously listening in.

corporate: ^“Foggy Lake Motel excels at employee welfare and always strives to make the workplace a habitable environment for all.”
^Nessie looks as if she’s trying not to laugh.
^“Did your Boss tell you to say that if anyone asked??”
^You shrug nonchalantly. She doesn’t need to know about his seemingly omnipresent awareness of criticisms.
bosstruth: ^“Job’s fine. As strict as any other workplace.”
^It appears as if she’s taking mental notes.
nonchalant: ^“You’re just here to get through the day then. I see how it is.”
^It feels like unseen eyes are on you as you form your next sentence.
^“My Boss can be… a lot. It’s alright though, I don’t mind. Anything for the guests!”
^She seems pleased with your self assuredness.
^You are always torn between helping someone out and angering your Boss, but the job wants what it wants, and guests ought to leave satisfied.
honesty: ^“Alright Nessie, time to be honest. Deep breaths.”
^Uh oh. Computer access is employees only, no messing about.
^You were once docked a week's pay just for playing flappy flatwoods monster on the internet during your break.
yespc: ^You really are sorry you can’t offer her anything else.
^To let a guest use the Motel Systems would spell disaster.
^“I see… It’s ok. I get it.”
^“I don’t want to get you in trouble if I can avoid it!!”
^You apologise and thank her for the understanding. Guests with her kindness are unusual and sorely missed.
nopc: ^“Pretty pretty please?? I promise I won’t break it, or download any weird programs...”
^She grins nervously, which only makes you suspicious of her prior track record with borrowing computers.
^“I can’t let you do that, I’d get in heaps of trouble.”
^She looks downtrodden, but gets back to muttering things about more plans and workarounds, so you suppose it takes more than that to stop her optimism.
planfoiled: ^“With that plan foiled I guess I’ll just have to leave you alone again.”
^“I bet I’m a real nuisance with the coming and going and then coming back again.”
^You do your best to reassure her with your customer service expression that it is all a part of the job.
^“There’s no need to be so corporate sometimes, jeez!”
^She bounces off to her room, and you are grateful to have some peace and quiet once more.
